Action: # Autoassign: Autoassign
autoassign/autoassign
## Autoassign by Publisher Account
Setup: Run the autoassign testdrive at /testdrive/autoassign if you have not already done so

Using the details under `map_by_account` in the testdrive setup, log in using the `publisher_username` and `publisher_password`

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//account/login
Go to the Publisher's list of Update Requests

Expected Test Results: There is one update request in the list, and you have an Edit button available

Action: Click on the Edit button for the update request
Make a minor change to the form data (e.g. change a URL or a title), then go to the final page of the form, select the confirmation checkbox, and click Submit.

Expected Test Results: Your update request is saved and you return to the Publisher's list of Update Requests

Action: Log out of the Publisher account
Using the details under `map_by_account` in the testdrive setup, log in using the `maned_username` and `maned_password`

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the Managing Editor's dashboard
There is a card on the dashboard for an Update Request, with the title of the journal you just edited
The editor group for the card is identified as "Account Mapping" (along with some random characters)

Action: Click on the Update Request card

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the Update Request form for the journal you just edited
The Group field is set to "Account Mapping" (along with some random characters)
There is no Individual editor set
There is a note with a recent timestamp indicating that this update request was autoassigned, and the reason for the assignment

Action: Click "Unlock & Close" then close the tab
Log out of the Managing Editor account
## Autoassign by Country
Setup: Run the autoassign testdrive at /testdrive/autoassign if you have not already done so

Using the details under `map_by_country` in the testdrive setup, log in using the `publisher_username` and `publisher_password`

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//account/login
Go to the Publisher's list of Update Requests

Expected Test Results: There is one update request in the list, and you have an Edit button available

Action: Click on the Edit button for the update request

Make a minor change to the form data (e.g. change a URL or a title), then go to the final page of the form, select the confirmation checkbox, and click Submit.  Note that this update request identifies the publisher's country as "Western Sahara", for which no real mapping exists at time of writing. If you are testing this in the future, you may need to change the country to one which does not have a mapping.

Expected Test Results: Your update request is saved and you return to the Publisher's list of Update Requests

Action: Log out of the Publisher account
Using the details under `map_by_country` in the testdrive setup, log in using the `maned_username` and `maned_password`

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the Managing Editor's dashboard
There is a card on the dashboard for an Update Request, with the title of the journal you just edited
The editor group for the card is identified as "Country Mapping" (along with some random characters)

Action: Click on the Update Request card

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the Update Request form for the journal you just edited
The Group field is set to "Country Mapping" (along with some random characters)
There is no Individual editor set
There is a note with a recent timestamp indicating that this update request was autoassigned, and the reason for the assignment

Action: Click "Unlock & Close" then close the tab
Log out of the Managing Editor account
## No Autoassignment
Setup: Run the autoassign testdrive at /testdrive/autoassign if you have not already done so

Using the details under `unmapped` in the testdrive setup, log in using the `publisher_username` and `publisher_password`

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//account/login
Go to the Publisher's list of Update Requests

Expected Test Results: There is one update request in the list, and you have an Edit button available

Action: Click on the Edit button for the update request

Make a minor change to the form data (e.g. change a URL or a title), then go to the final page of the form, select the confirmation checkbox, and click Submit.  Note that this update request identifies the publisher's country as "Western Sahara", for which no real mapping exists at time of writing. If you are testing this in the future, you may need to change the country to one which does not have a mapping.

Expected Test Results: Your update request is saved and you return to the Publisher's list of Update Requests

Action: Log out of the Publisher account
Using the details under `unmapped` in the testdrive setup, log in using the `maned_username` and `maned_password`

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the Managing Editor's dashboard
There is no card on the dashboard for the Update Request you just edited

Action:
Go to the Update Requests search page

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/update_requests
Order the update requests by "Last updated", with most recent first

Expected Test Results: The update request you just edited is at the top of the list

Action: Click on the "Review Update" button for the update request

Expected Test Results: There is no Group set
There is no Individual editor set
There is no note indicating that this update request was autoassigned

Action: Click "Unlock & Close" then close the tab
Log out of the Managing Editor account
## Autoassign import failure alert
Setup: Run the autoassign testdrive at /testdrive/autoassign if you have not already done so
Using the details under `map_by_account` in the testdrive setup, log in using the `admin_username` and `admin_password`

Go to the Admin Dashboard

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//dashboard

Expected Test Results: On the left navigation, there is a menu item with an alert triangle icon

Action:
Click on the menu item with the alert triangle icon

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/alerts

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the Admin Alerts page
The "new" alert filter is already selected
There is an alert from "Autoassign test" with a recent date

Action: Click "Set In Progress"

Expected Test Results: A pop-up tells you the operation was successful and to reload the page

Action: Reload the page

Expected Test Results: The alert has disappeared

Action: Clear the "new" filter using the X next to the filter name

Expected Test Results: All alerts are now visible, including the one you just set to "In Progress" (there may only be this one alert in the test system)
The alert has only one option "Mark Closed"
The alert has an audit trail showing that it was set to "In Progress" by the user

Action: Click "Mark Closed"

Expected Test Results: A pop-up tells you the operation was successful and to reload the page

Action: Reload the page

Expected Test Results: The alert is still visible, but now has a status of "Closed"
There are no buttons available on the alert.
The alert has an audit trail showing that it was marked closed by the user
